title: Lady Gaga Will Replace Pregnant-With-Twins Beyonc√© In Coachella Lineup
text:
03/01/2017 05:28 am ET | Updated 1 hour ago Lady Gaga Will Replace Pregnant-With-Twins Beyonc√© In Coachella Lineup She'll be the second woman to headline the festival. By Sara Boboltz 
Coachella ticket-holders disappointed they won‚Äôt be seeing Beyonc√© in April might find a little solace in this news: Lady Gaga has been tapped to headline in her place. 
We won‚Äôt be seeing the first black woman Coachella headliner quite yet. But at least organizers found another woman ‚Äï who will be just the second in the event‚Äôs 19-year history ‚Äï to headline instead. Bjork has topped lineups twice, in 2002 and 2007, and while the female-fronted Portishead was originally scheduled to headline in 2008, Prince turned up for the top slot. Let's party in the desert! üå¥‚úåÔ∏èüé§ pic.twitter.com/2SYOv7TscF ‚Äî xoxo, Joanne (@ladygaga) March 1, 2017 
It‚Äôs been a busy year for Gaga, who will perform both Saturdays of the six-day festival, April 15 and 22. After releasing her new album ‚ÄúJoanne‚Äù in October, she put on a stellar Super Bowl halftime show , announced a world tour that kicks off in August, and got up at the Grammys to perform ( albeit glitch-fully ) with Metallica last month. She‚Äôll be joined at the California festival by other headliners Radiohead and Kendrick Lamar. 
Beyonc√©, who is pregnant with twins , announced she‚Äôd be dropping out of the Coachella lineup last week on the advice of her doctors. Fans were not so happy. But Coachellans bent on seeing the ‚ÄúFormation‚Äù singer (in Gaga‚Äôs words) ‚Äúparty in the desert‚Äù will just have to wait another year ‚Äï she‚Äôs agreed to perform at the 2018 festival.
